input: DOCTOR: What brings you in today?\nPATIENT: Um, I guess I've just been feeling really weak, especially in my arms and legs, and I get tired super fast when I try to do anything active. Sometimes my muscles feel kinda weird, like they're stiff or sore after I play or walk around a lot. It's been worse over the last year, and I’m not sure why.
output:
THINKING: The patient reported feeling weak, especially in the arms and legs, experiencing fatigue with activity, and muscle stiffness or soreness after exertion. These symptoms have been worsening over the past year. No new symptoms have been introduced in this latest dialogue.

ANSWER: The patient has been experiencing weakness primarily in the arms and legs, fatigue easily with activity, and muscle stiffness or soreness after exertion. These symptoms have worsened over the last year.

input:
DOCTOR: What brings you in today?
PATIENT: Um, I guess I've just been feeling really weak, especially in my arms and legs, and I get tired super fast when I try to do anything active. Sometimes my muscles feel kinda weird, like they're stiff or sore after I play or walk around a lot. It's been worse over the last year, and I’m not sure why.
DOCTOR: Can you tell me more about how your symptoms have impacted your daily activities, and whether you've noticed any other changes like numbness, vision issues, or difficulties with coordination?
PATIENT: Well, I guess it's harder to do stuff like climb stairs or get up from sitting, and I get tired more easily than I used to. Sometimes my muscles feel kind of stiff or sore after I play. I haven't really noticed any numbness or vision problems, but I do feel a bit off sometimes, like I just feel weaker or more tired than usual, even if I haven't done much.
output:
THINKING: The patient has confirmed ongoing symptoms of weakness in the arms and legs, increased fatigue with activity, and muscle stiffness or soreness after exertion, which have been worsening over the past year. No new clinical details or symptoms have been introduced in this latest conversation.

ANSWER: The patient has been experiencing weakness primarily in the arms and legs, fatigue easily with activity, and muscle stiffness or soreness after exertion. These symptoms have worsened over the last year.

Sometimes my muscles feel kinda weird, like they're stiff or sore after I play or walk around a lot. It's been worse over the last year, and I’m not sure why.
DOCTOR: Can you tell me more about how your symptoms have impacted your daily activities, and whether you've noticed any other changes like numbness, vision issues, or difficulties with coordination?
PATIENT: Well, I guess it's harder to do stuff like climb stairs or get up from sitting, and I get tired more easily than I used to. Sometimes my muscles feel kind of stiff or sore after I play. I haven't really noticed any numbness or vision problems, but I do feel a bit off sometimes, like I just feel weaker or more tired than usual, even if I haven't done much.
DOCTOR: Can you tell me more about when your symptoms first started, how they have changed over time, and whether you've noticed any new symptoms like numbness, difficulty swallowing, or changes in sensation or coordination?
PATIENT: Um, I think it started about a year ago, like I was getting more tired when I was playing or trying to do stuff that used my muscles, and I noticed I was a little stiff sometimes. Lately, I've been feeling kind of funny, like, I don't know, maybe a little numb or weird in my arms or legs, but I'm not really sure if it's the same or different. I haven't really noticed anything like trouble swallowing or feeling different in my other senses, but sometimes I feel kind of shaky after exercising.
output:
THINKING: The patient has added the detail that the symptoms started about a year ago, with increasing fatigue, stiffness, and a feeling of being a little numb or weird in the arms or legs. They also mentioned feeling "kind of funny" or shaky after exercising. No new symptoms like trouble swallowing or changes in other senses were reported. The current info confirms the progression over a year and the presence of some altered sensations and post-exercise shakiness.

ANSWER: The patient has been experiencing weakness primarily in the arms and legs, fatigue easily with activity, muscle stiffness or soreness after exertion, a sensation of feeling "kind of funny" or numb in the arms or legs, and sometimes feels shaky after exercising. These symptoms began about a year ago and have worsened over that period.
